content.question: In a small town, water is being used at a rate of <math alttext="r of t equals, 12 plus, 9 times the sine of open parenthesis, 0.5 t, minus 1.6, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>r</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.5</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1.6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> thousand gallons per hour, where <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in hours since midnight. To the nearest integer, how much water, in thousands of gallons, is used in the town during the <math alttext="6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>-hour period from <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> A.M. (<math alttext="t equals 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></math>) to <math alttext="9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> A.M. (<math alttext="t equals 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></math>) ?

topic.text: 8.3: Using Accumulation Functions and Definite Integrals in Applied Contexts

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
